required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Chewing a Calcium Supplement Before Fluoride Rinse on Salivary Fluoride
clinical_study.official_title: Enhancing the Fluoride Retention in the Mouth by Chewing a Calcium Supplement Before Fluoride Rinse

brief_summary.textblock: The anticaries effect of fluoride is through the increase in fluoride presence and retention in the oral fluids, reducing dental demineralization and enhancing remineralization. Previous studies showed that a preapplication of calcium (in a rinse) prior to administration of fluoride greatly enhances fluoride concentration in the mouth and the anticaries effect of fluoride. The hypothesis of this study is that the same can be achieved by chewing a calcium supplement prior to a fluoride rinse. The first goal is to determine if chewing these calcium supplements will increase calcium concentration in the oral fluids above baseline levels. Secondly, the calcium supplement with the highest calcium release will be tested before a fluoride rinse to assess the increased retention of fluoride in the oral fluids when compared with the fluoride rinse alone. In both parts, healthy volunteers will participate and saliva will be collected to assess calcium and fluoride concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected as one spit, immediately before chewing one of the calcium supplements to be tested in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in the mixture of saliva and chewed calcium supplement
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after the 30-second chewing of calcium supplement
primary_outcome.description: Saliva and remnants of the chewed calcium supplement will be will be collected at the end of the chewing period (30 seconds) in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 15 seconds
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected as one spit, 15 seconds after chewing the calcium supplement in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 30 seconds
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected as one spit, 30 seconds after chewing the calcium supplement in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 45 seconds
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected as one spit, 45 seconds after chewing the calcium supplement in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 60 seconds
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected as one spit, 60 seconds after chewing the calcium supplement in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 120 seconds
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected as one spit, 120 seconds after chewing the calcium supplement in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 180 seconds
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected as one spit, 180 seconds after chewing the calcium supplement in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 240 seconds
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected as one spit, 240 seconds after chewing the calcium supplement in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 300 seconds
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected as one spit, 300 seconds after chewing the calcium supplement in Arm 1. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve of calcium concentration in saliva
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 15, 30, 45, 60, 120, 180, 240 and 300 seconds after chewing calcium supplements
primary_outcome.description: Calcium concentration in saliva collected at baseline (before chewing the supplements), and 15, 30, 45, 60, 120, 180, 240 and 300 seconds after chewing the supplements in Arm 1 will be expressed as the area under the curve of calcium concentration in saliva as a function of time (milimolar x min).

primary_outcome.measure: Fluoride concentration in saliva at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, immediately before chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Fluoride concentration will be determined using an ion-specific electrode.

primary_outcome.measure: Fluoride concentration in saliva at time 0
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, immediately after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Fluoride concentration will be determined using an ion-specific electrode.

primary_outcome.measure: Fluoride concentration in saliva at 5 min
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 5 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Fluoride concentration will be determined using an ion-specific electrode.

primary_outcome.measure: Fluoride concentration in saliva at 15 min
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 15 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Fluoride concentration will be determined using an ion-specific electrode.

primary_outcome.measure: Fluoride concentration in saliva at 30 min
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 30 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Fluoride concentration will be determined using an ion-specific electrode.

primary_outcome.measure: Fluoride concentration in saliva at 60 min
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 60 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Fluoride concentration will be determined using an ion-specific electrode.

primary_outcome.measure: Fluoride concentration in saliva at 120 min
primary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 120 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Fluoride concentration will be determined using an ion-specific electrode.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve of fluoride concentration in saliva
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 0, 5, 15, 30, 60 and 120 minutes after chewing supplement/mouthwashing
primary_outcome.description: Fluoride concentration in saliva collected at baseline (before treatments), and 0, 5, 15, 30, 60 and 120 minutes after chewing the supplements and/or rinsing the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2 will be expressed as the area under the curve of fluoride concentration in saliva as a function of time (micromolar x min).

other_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at baseline
other_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, immediately before chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

other_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at time 0
other_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, immediately after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

other_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 5 minutes
other_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 5 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

other_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 15 minutes
other_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 15 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

other_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 30 minutes
other_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 30 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

other_outcome.measure: Calcium concentration in saliva at 60 minutes
other_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 60 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

other_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for 2 min, 120 min after chewing a calcium supplement and/or rinse with the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2. Calcium concentration will be determined using a colorimetric method.

other_outcome.measure: Area under the curve of calcium concentration in saliva
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 0, 5, 15, 30, 60 and 120 minutes after chewing supplement/mouthwashing
other_outcome.description: Calcium concentration in saliva collected at baseline (before treatments), and 0, 5, 15, 30, 60 and 120 minutes after chewing the supplements and/or rinsing the fluoride mouthrinse in Arm 2 will be expressed as the area under the curve of calcium concentration in saliva as a function of time (milimolar x min).

arm_group.description: Participants will be given one of 4 different treatments to chew: a negative control group and 3 calcium supplements with different calcium compositions. Participants will be randomized to determine the sequence of exposure to the different treatments.
Participants will rinse with an over the counter sodium fluoride rinse for 1 min, either alone or after having chewed with the calcium supplement providing the maximum calcium release in arm 1.

intervention.description: Chewable candy used as a negative control in this arm of the study, which will be chewed for 1 minute.
Chewable tricalcium phosphate supplement, to be chewed for 1 minute.
Chewable calcium carbonate supplement, to be chewed for 1 minute.
Chewable calcium citrate supplement, to be chewed for 1 minute.
Over the counter sodium fluoride mouthwash, at a concentration of 0.05% (226 parts per millim (ppm) of fluoride), to be used for 1 minute and then expectorated.

A calcium supplement sill be chewed for 1 minute, immediately followed by a 1 minute rinse with an over the counter sodium fluoride mouthwash, at a concentration of 0.05% (226 parts per millim (ppm) of fluoride).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of signed and dated informed consent form
- Stated willingness to comply with all study procedures and availability for the duration of the study
- Reported good general health
- Reported good oral health
- Having at least 20 teeth in the mouth, being at least 4 (natural or crowned) teeth in all four quadrants of the mouth
- Having normal salivary flow rate according to direct flow rate determination methods
- Agreement to adhere to the study protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to understand and/or follow study instructions
- Hyposalivation
- Active periodontitis, identified by frequent bleeding of the gums
- Oral pain
- In need of urgent dental care

overall_official.last_name: Livia M Tenuta, DDS, MS, PhD

facility.name: School of Dentistry, University of Michigan
